授業目的: The aim of this course is to acquaint students with conceptual approaches and perspectives relevant to the understanding of conflict, and further familiarize students with issues and cases of actual conflicts. The overall objective is to introduce students to the field of international conflict studies in particular and international politics in general.
到達目標: Students will learn and become knowledgeable about fundamental concepts and theories of conflict. Students will develop a better understanding of the complex issues that cause international conflicts by studying actual cases of conflicts.
関連科目: Global Politics, International Relations, Conflict and Peace Studies, International Security, Modern History, International Organizations in World Politics.
授業の概要・背景: This course focuses on theoretical approaches to conflict and interrogates selected cases of interstate and intrastate conflicts with international implications. This is so designed to link concepts or theories with realities of conflicts.
授業方法: This is a lecture-based course. However, students are strongly encouraged to actively participate in the class by asking relevant questions, making comments, and expressing their thoughts.
